findings_by_domain.valuation_method: NPV at 8% WACC over 10-year replacement program
findings_by_domain.finding_summary: 148,000 lead service lines require replacement under EPA LCRI. Scenario B (hybrid utility/customer cost-sharing) creates $78M-$190M exposure. Scenario A (full utility payment) creates $432M-$918M exposure if CPUC disallows 60-70% as imprudent customer property costs.
findings_by_domain.mitigation: CPUC pre-approval of Scenario B cost allocation as mandatory closing condition; pursue federal BIL grants ($75M-$150M allocation); low-income assistance programs

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: 45,000 customers across 8 PFAS-contaminated systems. Class action claims include property value diminution ($225M-$675M), medical monitoring ($135M-$360M), punitive damages ($360M-$1.035B). 3M settlement covers infrastructure but NOT individual customer claims.
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Early settlement negotiations targeting $50M-$75M range; insurance declaratory relief against Zurich; verify 3M settlement participation and allocation ($6.75M-$13.5M)
findings_by_domain.insurance_notes: Zurich CGL pollution exclusion creates 55-65% probability of no indemnity; bad faith recovery potential $103M-$107M (2× policy + fees)

findings_by_domain.probability_description: 100% capital required; 40-60% late investment disallowance if delayed to 2031
findings_by_domain.valuation_method: NPV at 8% WACC including 2-3 year rate recovery delay
findings_by_domain.finding_summary: EPA PFAS MCL of 4 ppt (April 2024) requires treatment for 8 systems with 5-22 ppt detections. Colorado deadline April 2029 (2 years before federal). Delaying to 2031 creates $20M-$48M late investment disallowance risk.
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Deploy treatment systems by 2027-2028 to meet Colorado deadline; apply for EPA Emerging Contaminants grants ($27.5M-$60M); milestone-based escrow release tied to capital recovery approval

findings_by_domain.probability_description: 60% base case (10% disallowance), 25% bear case (15%), 15% bull case (0%)
findings_by_domain.valuation_method: NPV = $37.05M disallowance + ($4.86M annual revenue loss × 6.71 PVIFA) at 8% WACC
findings_by_domain.finding_summary: $380M deferred maintenance backlog: 1,200 miles cast iron mains (80-100 years old), 65-85 annual main breaks (1.4-1.8x worse than industry). CPUC may impose 10-15% disallowance penalty under prudent investment standard.
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Seller representation that backlog includes only 'used and useful' capital; implement 10-year capital plan ($78M-$98M annually); document commitment to AWWA benchmarks; $50M escrow for post-closing true-up

findings_by_domain.valuation_method: NPV at 8% WACC: rate freeze revenue loss (3 years) + customer credits (one-time)
findings_by_domain.finding_summary: CPUC approval (C.R.S. § 40-5-101) requires 10-14 months. Expected conditions: 3-year rate freeze ($42M-$63M revenue loss), customer credits ($15M-$30M), infrastructure commitments ($750M over 5 years), domestic control framework (45% foreign ownership scrutiny).
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Negotiate rate freeze cap at 2 years; customer credit cap at $15M; pre-application conference with CPUC staff; commit to domestic control framework upfront (Denver-based management, 50% dividend retention)

findings_by_domain.probability_description: 55-65% Zurich denies indemnity; 50-60% bad faith recovery if denied
findings_by_domain.valuation_method: Colorado statutory bad faith: 2× policy limit ($50M) + attorney fees
findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Zurich CGL pollution exclusion creates 55-65% probability of no indemnity for PFAS class action. If coverage denied, Colorado bad faith statute allows recovery of 2× policy limits + fees = $103M-$107M. Net risk-adjusted exposure $26M-$99.25M after bad faith offset.
findings_by_domain.mitigation: File declaratory relief action within 30 days of PFAS class certification; cite *Gray v. Zurich*, *Wolverine* precedents (passive distributor duty to defend); verify existence of EIL/PLL policies for alternative coverage
findings_by_domain.cross_reference: Q6 PFAS Class Action - insurance recovery reduces net litigation exposure

findings_by_domain.domain: Q2: Colorado River Water Rights Curtailment
findings_by_domain.probability_description: 45-55% probability of additional 10% curtailment beyond initial 4,500 AF
findings_by_domain.valuation_method: NPV = perpetual annual cost ($5.4M) ÷ 8% WACC OR 10-year NPV at 8%
findings_by_domain.finding_summary: 10% curtailment (4,500 AF/year) currently in effect due to Colorado River Compact Call. 45-55% probability of additional 10-20% curtailment (9,000-13,500 AF total). Supplemental water costs $850-$1,200/AF create $3.8M-$16.2M annual operating expense.
findings_by_domain.mitigation: Pursue supplemental water rights acquisitions; invest in water conservation/demand management programs; develop augmentation plan (subject to post-Firestone heightened approval standards); acquire senior water rights
